sn22.48:4.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you the five sets of phenomena and the five sets of phenomena connected with grasping.
sn22.48:4.4: And what are the five sets?
sn22.48:4.5: Any kind of physical phenomenon at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: this is called the set of physical phenomena.
sn22.48:4.6: Any kind of feeling at all …
sn22.48:4.7: Any kind of perception at all …
sn22.48:4.8: Any kind of choices at all …
sn22.48:4.10: Any kind of consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: this is called the set of consciousness.
sn22.48:4.11: These are called the five sets of phenomena.
sn22.48:5.1: And what are the five sets of phenomena connected with grasping?
sn22.48:5.2: Any kind of physical phenomenon at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior;
sn22.48:5.3: far or near, which is accompanied by defilements and is prone to being grasped: this is called the set of physical phenomena connected with grasping.
sn22.48:5.4: Any kind of feeling at all …
sn22.48:5.6: Any kind of perception at all …
sn22.48:5.8: Any kind of choices at all …
sn22.48:5.10: Any kind of consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior;
sn22.48:5.11: far or near, which is accompanied by defilements and is prone to being grasped: this is called the set of consciousness connected with grasping.
sn22.48:5.12: These are called the five sets of phenomena connected with grasping.”
